titles.title: Alas, and did my Savior bleed

properties.verseOrder: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Alas, and did my Savior bleed? And did my Sovereign die? Would He devote that sacred head For such a worm as I?

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: At the cross, at the cross where I first saw the light, And the burden of my heart rolled away, It was there by faith I received my sight, And now I am happy all the day!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Was it for sins that I had done He groaned upon the tree? Amazing pity! grace unknown! And love beyond degree!

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Well might the sun in darkness hide, And shut His glories in, When Christ, the mighty Maker, died For man, His creature’s sin.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Thus might I hide my blushing face While His dear cross appears. Dissolve my heart in thankfulness, And melt mine eyes to tears.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: But drops of grief can ne’er repay The debt of love I owe; Here, Lord, I give myself away, ’Tis all that I can do.
